jdm.name: Amazon
jdm.notes: To close your account, contact Amazon by email (via this contact form) and request that your account be closed.

points.title: Amazon may sell user data as part of a business transfer

tosdr.case: may sell your data in merger
tosdr.tldr: Amazon may sell user data as part of a business transfer

topics.description: When you give your data to a company, you need to keep in mind that this company can get acquired by another company, with different policies. What happens in that case?

topics.description: Once a service has your personal data, how much control do you have over how it will be used and how long?

topics.name: Personal Data
topics.subtitle: Can you control your privacy?
topics.title: Personal Data

points.title: This service tracks you on other websites

tosdr.tldr: This service and their partners use cookies to track you even if you are not interacting with the service directly. Information gathered about you could include: date and time you visit the site; the web address or URL you're on; technical information about the IP address, browser and the operating system you use; and, if you are logged in to the service at the same time, your user ID.

topics.description: Cookies are files stored locally in your web browser containing identifiable information.

points.title: Amazon enables third-party advertisers to target you by default

tosdr.tldr: Although Amazon does not share your personal informaton to advertiers and other third-parties that display Amazon's ads, by default they enable third-party advertises to target you (IP, cookies or “other features”). However, you can opt-out.

topics.description: The terms sometimes describe the level of logging and the level of data collection and which kinds of data the service is processing. Anonymity or the right to use a pseudonym can be very important for freedom of expression (e.g. for people exercising a certain profession, or people living in authoritarian regimes).

points.title: Terms may be changed at any time without advance notice

tosdr.tldr: The service can change the terms of service at any time, even without notification to the user. New or updated terms are posted on their site but your continued use of the service is taken as acceptance of the new or changed terms.

topics.description: Services need to evolve. But it is important that updating the service does not break the consentment with the user. Updates and changes to terms of service and privacy policy need to be properly noticed to users and to sollicit their agreement again.

topics.name: Notice of Changing Terms
topics.subtitle: Are users notified when terms change? Are they given enough time to find out what changed and discuss this with each other before deciding whether to continue to use the service under the new terms?
topics.title: Notice of Changing Terms

points.title: No promise to inform you about data requests from governments

tosdr.tldr: The service has made no promise to inform users a government request for their data has been made. As it's unlikely you'd know about the request, you'd have no real opportunity to object to the request being made or carried out.

points.title: No transparency on law enforcement requests

tosdr.tldr: The service is not making clear to their users what standards and rules law enforcement must follow when they seek access to sensitive user data.
